unnormalised: Rental yields in Mumbai showing some interesting trends, ya'll! Looks like some areas are doing a *lot* better than others. Forget owning that sea-facing Bandra pad – are you actually making money off it?
normalised: Rental yields in Mumbai showing some interesting trends, you all! Looks like some areas are doing a lot better than others. Forget owning that sea-facing Bandra pad – are you actually making money off it?

unnormalised: Turns out, smaller 1BHKs in areas like Chembur and Thane are quietly killing it, offering decent yields (around 3.5% - 4%). Meanwhile, those sprawling Juhu bungalows? Not so much. Maintaining those is a *chakkar*, financially speaking!
normalised: Turns out, smaller one B H K s in areas like Chembur and Thane are quietly killing it, offering decent yields (around three point five percent - four percent). Meanwhile, those sprawling Juhu bungalows? Not so much. Maintaining those is a chakkar, financially speaking!

unnormalised: Experts at HDFC Realty are saying that affordable housing options are the way to go for maximizing ROI right now. Think "Chak De! India" but for property investments!
normalised: Experts at H D F C Realty are saying that affordable housing options are the way to go for maximizing R O I right now. Think "Chak De! India" but for property investments!

unnormalised: Apparently, folks are prioritizing convenience and budget over sprawling spaces these days. Plus, the IT crowd in Bangalore is still driving rental demand like crazy, so yields there remain pretty solid.
normalised: Apparently, folks are prioritizing convenience and budget over sprawling spaces these days. Plus, the I T crowd in Bangalore is still driving rental demand like crazy, so yields there remain pretty solid.

unnormalised: So, before you go splurging on that Karan Johar-esque mansion, maybe consider a smaller, smarter investment. Think like a Sharma-ji, not a Raichand! Remember, a good yield is the *asli* happiness!
normalised: So, before you go splurging on that Karan Johar-esque mansion, maybe consider a smaller, smarter investment. Think like a Sharma-ji, not a Raichand! Remember, a good yield is the asli happiness!
